intro: Paratropia cumingiana, commonly known as the Cuming's paratropia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments at high elevations. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
